title: Beginner Spanish 101
details: This class is designed for beginners who have no prior knowledge of Spanish. You will learn the bsics of the language, including greetings, basic phrases, and simple sentence structures. By the end of the 4-week course, you will be able to hold basic conversations in Spanish.

title: Intermediate Spanish Conversation
details: This class is designed for intermediate Spanish speakers who want to improve their conversation skills. You will learn how to express yourself more confidently and fluently, and practice speaking with other classmates in a supportive environment. The class will cover advanced grammar concepts and idiomatic expressions.

title: Advanced Spanish Grammar and Composition
details: This class is designed for advanced Spanish speakers who want to improve their grammar skills and learn how to write more complex sentences. You will learn about the different tenses, moods, and structures of the Spanish language, and practice composing your own written pieces. The class will also include discussions on Spanish literature and culture.

title: Business Spanish for Professionals
details: This class is designed for professionals who need to communicate effectively in Spanish in a business setting. You will learn vocabulary and phrases specific to the workplace, including negotiation strategies, project management, and team building. The class will also include discussions on cultural differences and business etiquette in Spanish-speaking countries.

title: Spanish for Travelers
details: This class is designed for travelers who want to learn basic Spanish phrases and vocabulary before visiting a Spanish-speaking country. You will learn how to order food, ask for directions, and communicate with locals in a variety of situations. The class will also include cultural insights and tips for traveling in Spanish-speaking countries.

title: Introduction to Latin American Literature
details: This class is designed for students who want to learn about the rich history and culture of Latin American literature. You will explore the works of famous authors such as Gabriel Garcia Marquez, Isabel Allende, and Jorge Luis Borges, and discuss their themes and symbolism. The class will also include cultural discussions and debates on current events in Spanish-speaking countries.

title: Spanish for Healthcare Professionals
details: This class is designed for healthcare professionals who need to communicate effectively with Spanish-speaking patients. You will learn vocabulary and phrases specific to the medical field, including anatomy, diagnosis, and treatment. The class will also include discussions on cultural differences in healthcare and ethical considerations when communicating with patients.
